snippet: The Obama administration has freed schools in more than half the nation from central provisions of No Child Left Behind, raising the question of whether it has been essentially nullified.
abstract: Obama administration has freed schools in more than half the nation from central provisions of the No Child Left Behind education law, raising the question of whether the decade-old federal program has been essentially nullified; some 26 states have been granted waivers relieving them from meeting the lofty--and controversial--goal of making all students proficient in reading and mathematics by 2014, with additional waivers pending in nearly a dozen more.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has freed schools in more than half the nation from central provisions of No Child Left Behind, raising the question of whether it has been essentially nullified.

headline.seo: ‘No Child Left Behind’ Whittled Down Under Obama
headline.main: ‘No Child’ Law Whittled Down by White House
headline.print_headline: 'No Child' Law Whittled Down By White House
